summary: This document is an email chain between federal prosecutors discussing an attorney proffer from a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The proffer provides detailed information about Epstein's operations, including that Ghislaine Maxwell was the 'original girl finder,' and discusses potential investigative leads and interview planning.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pop
persons.context: Attorney representing a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who submitted an attorney proffer to the SDNY. He communicates with prosecutors about his client's potential testimony and arranges for an interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation. The document discusses his pattern of inducing sexual contact, his arrest in Florida, and his operations over decades.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by Epstein as the 'original girl finder.' The prosecutors discuss the potential use of this information in a prosecution against her.

connections.description: Epstein told the victim that Maxwell was the 'original girl finder,' indicating her central role in procuring victims for him.
Pop, as the victim's attorney, is in communication with AUSA M regarding the attorney proffer and potential interview arrangements.
The unnamed victim, represented by Pop, was induced by Epstein to have sexual contact and was asked to be with multiple friends of his.

events.title: Attorney Proffer Submission
events.description: Attorney Jeffrey Pop submits a detailed attorney proffer to the SDNY regarding his client's involvement with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prosecutor Communication on Victim Exposure
events.description: AUSA M communicates to attorney Jeff Pop that, based on initial information, his client does not appear to have criminal exposure related to her interactions with Epstein.

events.title: Proposed Interview Deadline
events.description: Attorney Pop proposes conducting an interview with his client before January 20, 2020, due to an upcoming trial.

keyFacts: Epstein told the victim that Ghislaine Maxwell was the 'original girl finder,' a statement prosecutors viewed as potentially useful evidence against Maxwell.

The victim's account confirms Epstein's pattern of operation and indicates he asked her to be with multiple friends of his, which was a detail previously only known from one other source (Virginia Giuffre, implied as 'VN').
The victim was an adult ('not close to being underage') during her involvement with Epstein, which was confined to New York.
The attorney proffer is described as 'remarkably thorough' and provides additional confirmation of known information while adding new relevant details.
Prosecutors expressed interest in identifying the names of other girls Epstein induced the victim to have sexual contact with, as well as the identities of Epstein's friends she was asked to be with.
